name: SearchTasksInWorkspace
description:
Search for tasks in an Asana workspace using complex filters.

Utilize this tool to perform an advanced search for tasks within a specified Asana workspace. It supports complex filters and is available to premium Asana users. Use it to find tasks with specific criteria, including custom field parameters. Note that pagination needs to be handled manually due to search result variability.

parameters.name: workspace_global_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace or organization where tasks are searched.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace or organization.

parameters.name: search_text
parameters.description: Full-text search on task names and descriptions within the workspace.

value_schema.description: Performs full-text search on both task name and description

parameters.name: task_resource_subtype
parameters.description: Filter tasks by their resource subtype, such as 'default_task', 'milestone', or 'approval'.

value_schema.description: Filters results by the task's resource_subtype

parameters.name: assignee_identifiers_any
parameters.description: Provide a comma-separated list of user identifiers for any assignee to include in the search.

parameters.name: exclude_assignees
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user identifiers to exclude from the search results.

parameters.name: portfolio_ids_included
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of portfolio IDs to include in the search.

parameters.name: project_ids_any
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of project IDs to include in the search.

parameters.name: exclude_projects_by_id
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of project IDs to exclude from the search results.

parameters.name: filter_by_all_projects
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of project IDs to filter tasks that belong to all specified projects.

parameters.name: include_sections_in_search
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of section or column IDs to filter tasks in the search.

value_schema.description: Comma-separated list of section or column IDs

parameters.name: exclude_sections_by_id
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of section or column IDs to exclude from the search results.

value_schema.description: Comma-separated list of section or column IDs

parameters.name: filter_sections_all
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of section or column IDs to filter tasks by inclusion in all specified sections.

value_schema.description: Comma-separated list of section or column IDs

parameters.name: include_any_tags_ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tag IDs to include in the search filter.

parameters.name: exclude_tags_by_ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of tag IDs to exclude from the search results.

parameters.name: all_tags_filters
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tag IDs to filter tasks that have all specified tags.

parameters.name: filter_by_any_team_ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of team IDs to filter tasks associated with any of these teams.

parameters.name: filter_by_any_follower_ids
parameters.description: Filter tasks by providing a comma-separated list of user IDs who are followers of the tasks.

parameters.name: exclude_followers_by_user_ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user identifiers to exclude from the followers filter.

parameters.name: created_by_users
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user IDs to filter tasks created by specific users.

parameters.name: exclude_created_by_user_ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user IDs to exclude from the search results.

parameters.name: assigned_by_user_ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of user IDs to filter tasks assigned by specific users.

parameters.name: exclude_assigned_by_users
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of user IDs to exclude tasks assigned by these users.

parameters.name: excluded_liked_by_user_ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of user IDs to exclude tasks liked by these users.

parameters.name: exclude_tasks_commented_by_users
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user identifiers to exclude tasks commented on by these users.

parameters.name: filter_due_date_before
parameters.description: Specify tasks with a due date earlier than this ISO 8601 date string.

parameters.name: tasks_due_after_date
parameters.description: Specify an ISO 8601 date string to filter tasks due after this date.

parameters.name: due_date_on
parameters.description: Filter tasks due on a specific date using an ISO 8601 date string or specify `null` for tasks with no due date.

parameters.name: due_at_before
parameters.description: An ISO 8601 datetime string to filter tasks due before this date and time.

parameters.name: due_at_after_datetime
parameters.description: Specify the start date and time for tasks due after this point. Use an ISO 8601 datetime string.

parameters.name: end_date_before_start_on
parameters.description: Filter tasks starting before a specified date, using an ISO 8601 date string.

parameters.name: start_date_after
parameters.description: An ISO 8601 date string to filter tasks starting after this date.

parameters.name: start_on_date
parameters.description: ISO 8601 date string specifying the start date of tasks to be searched, or `null` for unspecified.

parameters.name: created_on_before_date
parameters.description: Filter tasks created before a specific date using an ISO 8601 date string format.

parameters.name: created_after_date
parameters.description: Specify the earliest creation date for tasks using an ISO 8601 date string. Filters tasks created after this date.

parameters.name: created_on_date
parameters.description: Filter tasks by their creation date using an ISO 8601 date string or `null`.

parameters.name: created_at_before
parameters.description: An ISO 8601 datetime string to filter tasks created before this date and time.

parameters.name: created_after_datetime
parameters.description: Filter tasks created after this ISO 8601 datetime string.

parameters.name: completed_on_before_date
parameters.description: Filter tasks completed before a specific date using an ISO 8601 date string.

parameters.name: completed_on_after_date
parameters.description: Specify an ISO 8601 date to filter tasks completed after this date.

parameters.name: completed_on_date
parameters.description: Filter tasks by their completion date using an ISO 8601 date string or `null` for no specific date.

parameters.name: completed_at_before_datetime
parameters.description: Filter tasks completed before the specified ISO 8601 datetime.

parameters.name: completed_at_after
parameters.description: Specify an ISO 8601 datetime string to filter tasks completed after this date and time.

parameters.name: before_modified_on_date
parameters.description: ISO 8601 date string to filter tasks modified before this date.

parameters.name: filter_modified_date_start
parameters.description: Start date to filter tasks modified after this date in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: last_modified_on
parameters.description: ISO 8601 date string or `null` to filter tasks based on the modification date.

parameters.name: modified_at_before_date
parameters.description: Filter tasks modified before this date. Use ISO 8601 datetime format.

parameters.name: modified_after_datetime
parameters.description: Filter tasks modified after this ISO 8601 datetime string.

parameters.name: task_sort_order
parameters.description: Specify the sorting criteria for the task results. Options include 'due_date', 'created_at', 'completed_at', 'likes', or 'modified_at'. Defaults to 'modified_at'.

parameters.name: included_optional_properties
parameters.description: List of optional properties to include for each returned task. Provide as comma-separated values.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Formats the response with line breaks and indentation for readability. Use for debugging, as it increases response size and processing time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: filter_to_incomplete_tasks_with_dependents
parameters.description: Set to true to filter tasks to those that are incomplete and have dependents.

value_schema.description: Filter to incomplete tasks with dependents

parameters.name: filter_tasks_with_incomplete_dependencies
parameters.description: Filter tasks to those with incomplete dependencies. Use true to apply the filter.

value_schema.description: Filter to tasks with incomplete dependencies

parameters.name: filter_tasks_with_attachments
parameters.description: Set to true to filter tasks that have attachments, and false to include all tasks regardless of attachments.

parameters.name: filter_to_completed_tasks
parameters.description: Set to true to filter and display only completed tasks.

parameters.name: include_only_subtasks
parameters.description: Set to true to include only subtasks in the results, false to include all tasks.

parameters.name: sort_results_ascending
parameters.description: Set to true to sort search results in ascending order. Default is false.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_pretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.description: Performs full-text search on both task name and description

value_schema.description: Performs full-text search on both task name and description

parameters.description: Filters results by the task's resource_subtype

value_schema.description: Filters results by the task's resource_subtype
